body:
Facebook, Inc. (FB) ended last trading session with a change of 0.99 percent. It trades at an average volume of 22.86M shares versus 19.89M shares recorded at the end of last trading session. The share price of $132.78 is at a distance of 40.91 percent from its 52-week low and down -0.54 percent versus its peak. The company has a market cap of $384.23B and currently has 2.89B shares outstanding. The share price is currently 7.24 percent versus its SMA20, 10 percent versus its SMA50, and 9.38 percent versus its SMA200. The stock has a weekly performance of 4.1 percent and is 15.41 percent year-to-date as of the recent close.

On Jan. 3, 2017 Facebook, Inc. (FB) announced that the company’s fourth quarter and full year 2016 financial results will be released after market close on Wednesday, February 1, 2017.

Facebook will host a conference call to discuss its results at 2 p.m. PT / 5 p.m. ET the same day. The live webcast of the call can be accessed at the Facebook Investor Relations website at investor.fb.com, along with the company’s earnings press release, financial tables, and slide presentation.

Micron Technology, Inc. (MU) recently recorded -0.17 percent change and currently at $23.52 is 151.55 percent away from its 52-week low and down -1.92 percent versus its peak. It has a past 5-day performance of 8.34 percent and trades at an average volume of 25.89M shares. The stock has a 1-month performance of 1.12 percent and is 7.3 percent year-to-date as of the recent close. There were about 1.09B shares outstanding which made its market cap $25.64B. The share price is currently 5.13 percent versus its SMA20, 12.96 percent versus its SMA50, and 48.39 percent versus its SMA200.

Micron Technology, Inc. (MU) will host an analyst conference on Thursday, February 2, 2017.  Presentations by Micron executives will begin at 9 a.m. MT and the event is expected to conclude at 11:30 a.m. MT.

A live webcast and subsequent replay can be accessed from Micron’s Investor Relations website at http://investors.micron.com.
title: 2 Sizzling Hot Tech Stocks: Facebook (FB), Micron Technology (MU) | The Independent Republic
